intro: Impatiens verdickii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with velvety, dark green leaves. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with five petals that often feature a contrasting color at the base. Impatiens verdickii is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in shaded environments and its long blooming period.
